page.title: 04ELMDON PARK
page.content: IN THE PARK IS A VERY OLD BEECH TREE, IT HAS A MASSIVE TRUNK.12 CHILDREN WITH LINKED HANDS STRETCHED ROUND IT. THERE ARE LOTS OF OPEN SPACES WITH EVER GREENS AND DECIDUOUS TREES DOTTED AROUND .THE PARK GIVES LOTS OF SPACE FOR PLAYING GAMES AND WALKING.ON THE HIGHEST POINT IN THE PARK IS THE VERY OLD ELMDON CHURCH AND A SMALL GRAVE YARD WITH A CAR PARK FOR VISITORS.THE RECTOR AT THE CHURCH IS THE REVERANT STANLEY OWEN.REGULAR SERVICES ARE HELD AT THE CHURCH.ELMDON HOUSE,USED TO BE A FARM IT IS NOW CONVERTED INTO FLATS. AT THE BOTTOM OF THE HILL IN THE PARK IS A LAKE.THE PARK IS SURROUNDED BY LAND ROVER,FARM LAND,BIRMINGHAM AIRPORT,HOUSES AND SPORTS FIELDS.
